description.value:
Oreads are humanoids whose bloodline is infused with power from the Plane of Earth, such as from a shaitan. Oreads usually have skin of a dark neutral tone, and some have features that appear to be made of stone, crystal, or packed earth. Oreads are generally calm to the point of stoicism.

Ability Adjustments +2 Str, +2 Wis, –2 Cha
Hit Points 6

Size and Type

Oreads are Medium outsiders with the native subtype.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.ursgilW1UIpEd3vc]{Acid Resistance}

Oreads have acid resistance 5.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.HhrIJeHTxSGVX9mV]{Darkvision}

Oreads have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.12EB1YcNhJnwzIGh]{Earth Affinity}

Whenever an oread deals acid damage (including with spells such as energy ray), the oread can change it to bludgeoning damage instead. This doesn’t change anything else about the effect dealing the damage.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.9qOkQQ3jDPmNl78N]{Spell-Like Ability}

An oread can use @Compendium[sfrpg.spells.xNs98gJ8XLhmVyR3]{Energy Ray} as a spell-like ability at will but can deal only acid damage with the ray. The oread’s caster level is equal to their level.

Alternate Racial Traits

The following are alternate racial traits for planar scions.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.qETRBUQxQpYb9uIW]{Mountain Rapport}

Source AP #46 pg. 53
Some oreads feel especially at home in mountainous environments. Oreads with this trait gain a +2 racial bonus to @Compendium[sfrpg.skills.6by4xbwlnTJWmiOG]{Acrobatics} checks to balance across narrow ledges, @Compendium[sfrpg.skills.HsCWctv7usPI6Gvd]{Athletics} checks to climb stony inclines, and Fortitude saves to prevent being fatigued by thin @Compendium[sfrpg.rules.z2JnsaHKE5QvwVSQ]{Atmospheres} due to altitude (Core Rulebook 397).

This replaces earth affinity.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.X6bpbuzxguajA7Yy]{Static Discharge}

Source AP #46 pg. 53
Some oreads born of waterless sand planets can draw upon the friction of their desert worlds to channel their elemental opposite. An oread with this trait can cast @Compendium[sfrpg.spells.yFhvmdW0BnMHV3Sm]{Jolting Surge} once per day with a caster level equal to their level. At 8th level, they can use this ability one additional time per day; at 16th level, they gain a third use per day.

This replaces an oread’s spell-like ability.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.JWMBE2ja8VmCo5m6]{Warp Element}

Source AP #46 pg. 53
When a planar scion with this trait makes an attack or casts a spell that would deal acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage, they can instead choose to match half of that damage to the element of their heritage (fire for ifrits, acid for oreads, electricity for sylphs, or cold for undines).

This replaces each planar scion’s elemental affinity.
